@description.name: @description
@description.body:
A "virtual" tree

A number of convenience methods are available in the following mixins:

  • {@link qx.ui.treevirtual.MNode}
  • {@link qx.ui.treevirtual.MFamily}

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
headings {Array | String}
An array containing a list of strings, one for each column, representing
the headings for each column.  As a special case, if only one column is
to exist, the string representing its heading need not be enclosed in an
array.
@param.description:
An array containing a list of strings, one for each column, representing
the headings for each column.  As a special case, if only one column is
to exist, the string representing its heading need not be enclosed in an
array.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
custom {Map ? null} A map provided (typically) by subclasses, to override the various supplemental classes allocated within this constructor. For normal usage, this parameter may be omitted. Each property must be an object instance or a function which returns an object instance, as indicated by the defaults listed here:
initiallyHiddenColumns
{Array?} A list of column numbers that should be initially invisible. Any column not mentioned will be initially visible, and if no array is provided, all columns will be initially visible.
dataModel
new qx.ui.treevirtual.SimpleTreeDataModel()
treeDataCellRenderer
Instance of {@link qx.ui.treevirtual.SimpleTreeDataCellRenderer}. Custom data cell renderer for the tree column.
treeColumn
The column number in which the tree is to reside, i.e., which column uses the SimpleTreeDataCellRenderer or a subclass of it.
defaultDataCellRenderer
Instance of {@link qx.ui.treevirtual.DefaultDataCellRenderer}. Custom data cell renderer for all columns other than the tree column.
dataRowRenderer
new qx.ui.treevirtual.SimpleTreeDataRowRenderer()
selectionManager
function(obj)
{
return new qx.ui.treevirtual.SelectionManager(obj);
}
tableColumnModel
function(obj)
{
return new qx.ui.table.columnmodel.Resize(obj);
}
@param.description:
A map provided (typically) by subclasses, to override the various supplemental classes allocated within this constructor. For normal usage, this parameter may be omitted. Each property must be an object instance or a function which returns an object instance, as indicated by the defaults listed here:
initiallyHiddenColumns
{Array?} A list of column numbers that should be initially invisible. Any column not mentioned will be initially visible, and if no array is provided, all columns will be initially visible.
dataModel
new qx.ui.treevirtual.SimpleTreeDataModel()
treeDataCellRenderer
Instance of {@link qx.ui.treevirtual.SimpleTreeDataCellRenderer}. Custom data cell renderer for the tree column.
treeColumn
The column number in which the tree is to reside, i.e., which column uses the SimpleTreeDataCellRenderer or a subclass of it.
defaultDataCellRenderer
Instance of {@link qx.ui.treevirtual.DefaultDataCellRenderer}. Custom data cell renderer for all columns other than the tree column.
dataRowRenderer
new qx.ui.treevirtual.SimpleTreeDataRowRenderer()
selectionManager
function(obj)
{
return new qx.ui.treevirtual.SelectionManager(obj);
}
tableColumnModel
function(obj)
{
return new qx.ui.table.columnmodel.Resize(obj);
}

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Whether a click on the open/close button should also cause selection of
the row.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Return the data model for this tree.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Set whether lines linking tree children shall be drawn on the tree.
Note that not all themes support tree lines.  As of the time of this
writing, the Classic theme supports tree lines (and uses +/- icons
which lend themselves to tree lines), while the Modern theme, which
uses right-facing and downward-facing arrows instead of +/-, does not.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: b {Boolean} true if tree lines should be shown; false otherwise.
@param.description: true if tree lines should be shown; false otherwise.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get whether lines linking tree children shall be drawn on the tree.

@return.name: @return
@return.desc: true if tree lines are in use; false otherwise.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Set whether the open/close button should be displayed on a branch,
even if the branch has no children.

@param.name: @param
@param.description: true if the open/close button should be shown; false otherwise.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Set whether drawing of first-level tree-node lines are disabled even
if drawing of tree lines is enabled.

@param.name: @param
@param.description: true if first-level tree lines should be disabled; false for normal operation.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Get whether drawing of first-level tree lines should be disabled even
if drawing of tree lines is enabled.
(See also {@link #getUseTreeLines})

@return.name: @return
@return.desc: true if tree lines are in use; false otherwise.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Set whether the open/close button should be displayed on a branch,
even if the branch has no children.

@return.name: @return
@return.desc: true if tree lines are in use; false otherwise.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set the selection mode.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
mode {Integer} The selection mode to be used. It may be any of: 
qx.ui.treevirtual.TreeVirtual.SelectionMode.NONE:
Nothing can ever be selected.

qx.ui.treevirtual.TreeVirtual.SelectionMode.SINGLE
Allow only one selected item.

qx.ui.treevirtual.TreeVirtual.SelectionMode.SINGLE_INTERVAL
Allow one contiguous interval of selected items.

qx.ui.treevirtual.TreeVirtual.SelectionMode.MULTIPLE_INTERVAL
Allow any selected items, whether contiguous or not.
@param.description:
The selection mode to be used. It may be any of: 
qx.ui.treevirtual.TreeVirtual.SelectionMode.NONE:
Nothing can ever be selected.

qx.ui.treevirtual.TreeVirtual.SelectionMode.SINGLE
Allow only one selected item.

qx.ui.treevirtual.TreeVirtual.SelectionMode.SINGLE_INTERVAL
Allow one contiguous interval of selected items.

qx.ui.treevirtual.TreeVirtual.SelectionMode.MULTIPLE_INTERVAL
Allow any selected items, whether contiguous or not.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the selection mode currently in use.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Integer}
One of the values documented in {@link #setSelectionMode}
@return.desc: One of the values documented in {@link #setSelectionMode}

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Obtain the entire hierarchy of labels from the root down to the
specified node.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
nodeReference {Object | Integer}
The node for which the hierarchy is desired.  The node can be
represented either by the node object, or the node id (as would have
been returned by addBranch(), addLeaf(), etc.)
@param.description:
The node for which the hierarchy is desired.  The node can be
represented either by the node object, or the node id (as would have
been returned by addBranch(), addLeaf(), etc.)

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Array}
The returned array contains one string for each label in the
hierarchy of the node specified by the parameter.  Element 0 of the
array contains the label of the root node, element 1 contains the
label of the node immediately below root in the specified node's
hierarchy, etc., down to the last element in the array contain the
label of the node referenced by the parameter.
@return.desc:
The returned array contains one string for each label in the
hierarchy of the node specified by the parameter.  Element 0 of the
array contains the label of the root node, element 1 contains the
label of the node immediately below root in the specified node's
hierarchy, etc., down to the last element in the array contain the
label of the node referenced by the parameter.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Return the nodes that are currently selected.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Array}
An array containing the nodes that are currently selected.
@return.desc: An array containing the nodes that are currently selected.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Event handler. Called when a key was pressed.

We handle the Enter key to toggle opened/closed tree state.  All
other keydown events are passed to our superclass.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
evt {Map}
The event.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Event handler. Called when the selection has changed.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
evt {Map}
The event.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Calculate and return the set of nodes which are currently selected by the user, on the screen. In the process of calculating which nodes are selected, the nodes corresponding to the selected rows on the screen are marked as selected by setting their bSelected property to true, and all previously-selected nodes have their bSelected property reset to false.

@return.name: @return
@return.desc:
An array of nodes matching the set of rows which are selected on the
screen.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set the overflow mode.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
s {String}
Overflow mode.  The only allowable mode is "hidden".
@param.description: Overflow mode.  The only allowable mode is "hidden".

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{Error}
Error if tree overflow mode is other than "hidden"

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Finds the first scrollable parent (in the parent chain).

@param.name: @param
@param.body: widget {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} The widget to start from.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the widget is scrollable.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: widget {qx.ui.core.Widget} The widget to check.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the bounds of the given scrollable.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: scrollable {qx.ui.core.Widget} Scrollable which has scrollbar child controls.
@param.description: Scrollable which has scrollbar child controls.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map} A map with all four bounds (e.g. {"left":0, "top":20, "right":0, "bottom":80}).
@return.desc: A map with all four bounds (e.g. {"left":0, "top":20, "right":0, "bottom":80}).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the edge type or null if the pointer isn't within one of the thresholds.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: diff {Map} Difference map with all for edgeTypes.
@param.description: Difference map with all for edgeTypes.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: thresholdX {Number} x-axis threshold.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: thresholdY {Number} y-axis threshold.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the axis ('x' or 'y') by the edge type.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: edgeType {String} One of the four edgeTypes ('left', 'right', 'top', 'bottom').

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} If edgeType is not one of the distinct four ones.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the threshold amount by edge type.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: edgeType {String} One of the four edgeTypes ('left', 'right', 'top', 'bottom').

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Number} The threshold of the x or y axis.
@return.desc: The threshold of the x or y axis.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the scrollbar is visible.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: scrollable {qx.ui.core.Widget} Scrollable which has scrollbar child controls.
@param.description: Scrollable which has scrollbar child controls.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: axis {String} Can be 'y' or 'x'.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the scrollbar is exceeding it's maximum position.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: scrollbar {qx.ui.core.scroll.IScrollBar} Scrollbar to check.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: axis {String} Can be 'y' or 'x'.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: amount {Number} Amount to scroll which may be negative.
@param.description: Amount to scroll which may be negative.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the amount will exceed the scrollbar max position.
@return.desc: Whether the amount will exceed the scrollbar max position.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Calculates the threshold exceedance (which may be negative).

@param.name: @param
@param.body: diff {Number} Difference value of one edgeType.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: threshold {Number} x-axis or y-axis threshold.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Calculates the scroll amount (which may be negative).
The amount is influenced by the scrollbar size (bigger = faster)
the exceedanceAmount (bigger = faster) and the slowDownFactor.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: scrollbarSize {Number} Size of the scrollbar.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: exceedanceAmount {Number} Threshold exceedance amount (positive or negative).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Scrolls the given scrollable on the given axis for the given amount.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: scrollable {qx.ui.core.Widget} Scrollable which has scrollbar child controls.
@param.description: Scrollable which has scrollbar child controls.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: axis {String} Can be 'y' or 'x'.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: exceedanceAmount {Number} Threshold exceedance amount (positive or negative).

@description.name: @description
